business.headline: Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

Flipkart ends WFH policy, asks all employees to work from office: ReportFlipkart had initially offered flexibility to employees during the pandemic. But over the past year, the company began rolling back the policy in phases—first calling senior executives back to office. Now, the mandate applies to all employees, regardless of role or function.

Vijay Kedia warns of 10 red flags to spot a potential scam amid Gensol fraudInvestor and market expert Vijay Kedia has warned that Gensol is not the only company with problems amid the findings by Sebi.

Rs 25 lakh in India or $100K in US? Bengaluru techie weighs in on what's betterChoosing to stay in India means staying close to family, celebrating festivals, and living within a culture you know well, said the tech professional.

PhonePe rolls out UPI Circle, simplifies payments for family and friendsUPI Circle is a feature by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) where a primary user gives permission to a secondary user to make payments from their UPI account, within set limits.

Sebi's job is to find and punish them: Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Gensol fraudThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) released an interim order on April 15, stating that Gensol Engineering's promoters, brothers Anmol and Puneet Singh Jaggi, had diverted company funds for personal use.

Surprise rally lights up Dalal Street, Sensex jumps 1,500 points. Here's whyShare market today: Despite a slight uptick in volatility, sentiment turned decisively positive as fears around global trade tensions began to fade. Broader market indices joined the rally, reflecting widespread optimism among investors.

End of the road for BluSmart as Sebi exposes Gensol fraudMany users across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai reported that they could no longer book rides through the BluSmart app. The company also sent a notification to users stating that bookings were being temporarily closed.

Infosys Q4 results today: All eyes on FY26 outlook, dividend detailsInfosys Q4FY25 results: As the second-largest software services exporter gears up to release its earnings, investors will be watching closely for guidance on FY26 revenue growth, margins, and management's take on business sentiment in key markets.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 5% lower circuit for 2nd straight dayGensol Engineering share price: The stock plunged 5% to Rs 117.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), hitting yet another all-time low.

Explained: Why Nvidia's market value dropped $148 billion overnightNvidia shares were hit hard in the overnight trading session on Wall Street, falling nearly 7% and losing $148 billion in market value.

entertainment.headline: Demi Moore finally breaks silence on losing Oscar to Anora star Mikey MadisonDemi Moore, 'The Substance' actor, revealed how she felt after losing the Oscar for Best Actress to Mikey Madison. Mikey bagged the award for her performance in the film 'Anora'.

Hailee Steinfeld: I was a crybaby on last day of shoot | ExclusiveHailee Steinfeld reflects on her emotional last day on the set of Ryan Coogler's upcoming vampire thriller 'Sinners', where she plays the role of Mary alongside Michael B Jordan. The film, which explores complex character dynamics and personal histories, is set to release in India on April 18.

Parvathy to Samantha, celebs wish Nazriya Nazim healing after emotional postAfter Nazriya Nazim shared a post explaining her social media absence, she received a lot of love from her industry colleagues and fans. Samantha, Parvathy, Tovino Thomas and several others wished her speedy recovery and healing.

YouTuber claims 'fake paneer served' at Gauri Khan's Torii, restaurant reactsA popular YouTuber alleged the use of fake paneer at Gauri Khan's high-end restaurant, Torii. The establishment addressed the claims and issued a response.

Mimi changed a lot of things for me, it got me more work, says Sai TamhankarSai Tamhankar credits her performance in the film 'Mimi' as a significant career milestone, opening new professional and personal opportunities. The actor shares her journey of evolving through diverse roles and the impact of receiving appreciation for her work.

WAVES Summit 2025: Cultivating next-gen filmmaking talent in IndiaWAVES Summit 2025, organised by FICCI and the Ministry of Information & Broadcasting, is set to revolutionise the media and entertainment industry. The event promises to be a landmark for aspiring filmmakers and storytellers.
Jaat 2 announced: Sunny Deol reunites with director Gopichand MalineniAfter its successful run, Sunny Deol announced 'Jaat 2'. The actor will be seen reprising his role as Baldev Pratap Singh.

Varun Grover's witty take on Kunal Kamra row, adds funny disclaimer to new videoComedian Varun Grover humorously addressed the controversy surrounding fellow comedian Kunal Kamra during a recent performance. Kamra faced backlash from Shiv Sena for his parody song mocking Maharashtra's deputy CM Eknath Shinde.

Good Bad Ugly box office Day 7: Ajith's film gets strong push ahead of 2nd weekendAjith's film 'Good Bad Ugly' is doing good business at the box office, both domestically and worldwide. The film has already emerged as the top Tamil grosser of the year so far, and is only the second film on Ajith's resume in the global Rs 200 crore club.

Malayalam actor Vincy accuses Shine Tom Chacko of drug abuse, misconductMalayalam actor Vincy Aloshious filed a complaint against Shine Tom Chacko with the Kerala Film Chamber of Commerce. She had earlier accused her co-star of using drugs on set and misbehaving with her.

The Royals: Ishaan Khatter, Bhumi Pednekar's coming-of-age drama to release in MayIshaan Khatter and Bhumi Pednekar's upcoming series, 'The Royals', is set to premiere on Netflix on May 9. The makers announced the date with a poster.

Logout review: Babil Khan gets likes, followers and chaos in tech thrillerReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025Babil Khan's 'Logout' will stream on Zee5 from April 18 onwards. The thriller offers a chilling commentary on digital obsession and the following psychological unraveling. Read our review.

Shahid Kapoor wows with 'Shaandaar' performance at event, KJo and Sushmita joinBollywood star Shahid Kapoor made a memorable appearance at Seema Singh's daughter's sangeet ceremony last night. He entertained the guests with his dance moves to 'Mauja Hi Mauja' and singing 'Shaam Shaandaar'.

Jaat box office Day 7: Sunny Deol gets 3rd biggest film of his career after GadarSunny Deol's 'Jaat' is already the third highest-grossing film of his career after 'Gadar' and 'Gadar 2'. The film is currently running decently in theatres with its seven-day business in the range of Rs 57 crore nett.

Kajol and Malaika Arora's heartwarming hug at Mumbai event wins InternetAt a recent Mumbai event, Bollywood stars Kajol and Malaika Arora shared a warm embrace, capturing the attention of fans and media alike. The duo's chemistry was the highlight of the evening, as fans couldn't stop gushing over the moment.

Apoorva Mukhija hints at vacating Mumbai home after India's Got Latent rowInfluencer and actor Apoorva Mukhija seemed to have moved out of her Mumbai house, months after India's Got Latent controversy. She shared a short video giving a glimpse of the empty house.

Picture abhi baki hai: Ranveer Allahbadia says 'brother' Samay Raina will be backRanveer Allahbadia conducted an 'Ask Me Anything' session on Instagram addressing the India's Got Latent controversy and the events that followed. He revealed stronger ties with Samay Raina and support for Ashish Chanchlani and Apoorva Mukhija.

Prithviraj and Malayalam celebs honoured at Kerala State Film Awards presentationChief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan presented Kerala State Film Awards (2023) in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday. Prithviraj Sukumaran, Urvashi and many others were honoured for their exceptional work.

Anurag Kashyap slams Brahmin outfits opposing Phule, calls out rigged systemAnurag Kashyap criticised Brahminical groups for opposing Hindi film 'Phule', highlighting issues of casteism and a compromised system. He questioned the access that fringe groups have to unreleased films and called out censorship practices.

general news.headline: No waqf appointments, changes to waqf by user till next hearing: Supreme CourtThe Centre assured the Supreme Court that no appointments would be made to Waqf boards. The new law makes it compulsory to include non-Muslims as its members.

We are different from Hindus: Pak Army chief invokes Two-Nation TheoryPakistan's Army chief, General Asim Munir, has urged Pakistanis to pass down the ideology that led to the creation of the Islamic Republic. In a public speech, Munir doubled down on the differences between Hindus and Muslims, as he invoked the Two-Nation Theory, the cornerstone of Pakistan's creation and identity.

BJP slams Tamil Nadu government using 'temple' logo on Karunanidhi's memorialA replica of a temple structure, similar to that of Srivilliputhur kovil tower, atop M Karunanidhi's memorial has triggered a political row in Tamil Nadu. The BJP accused the ruling DMK of insulting Hindu sentiments.

Supreme Court allows Bengal to retain 'untainted' teachers till fresh selectionThe Supreme Court allowed the West Bengal government to continue the employment of 'untainted' assistant teachers for classes 9-12. The teachers' jobs were terminated earlier this month due to irregularities in the selection process.

First Indian-origin woman elected President of UK's Royal College of PhysiciansMumtaz Patel became the first British-Indian woman to be elected the President of the Royal College of Physicians (RCP). She will be just the fourth woman head in the RCP's 500-year history. The Indo-British Muslim doctor was awarded the Outstanding Leader Award last year.

No protection for those marrying against parents' wish: Allahabad High CourtThe Allahabad High Court ruled that couples marrying against their parents' wishes cannot demand police protection as a right unless there's a real threat to their safety.

BCCI sacks 4 support staff members after bad performance in Border–Gavaskar TrophyThe BCCI has removed four support staff members from the Indian cricket team following the 3-1 loss in the Border Gavaskar Trophy. Those removed include batting coach Abhishek Nair, fielding coach T Dilip, and strength and conditioning coach Soham Desai. This action comes amid reports of rifts within the team and concerns about discipline. The BCCI has not immediately announced replacements for the removed staff.

Credit to Starc but saliva makes a lot of difference: Nitish on Super Over lossRajasthan Royals batter Nitish Rana credited Mitchell Starc for his sensational 20th over but added that the return of saliva has made a massive difference to the game.

"We had our moments, but Starc was ice cold under pressure...to execute 11 out of the 12 yorkers he bowled perfectly at 145 Km/hr with the ball reversing, you have to give him the due credit", Rana said in the post match press conference.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
